website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, compact grill that nevertheless offers plenty of cooking surface, but heating is uneven. Folds up into an easy-to-carry profile.
pros: Responsive customer service and good warranty
cons: Drip pan doesn't latch and can slide around while carrying
Controlling temperature is tricky, grill heats fast with lid closed
Igniter tends to fail early and often

website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a portable grill, this is a good choice despite a few design flaws.
pros: total cooking/warming space encased in solid stainless steel housing that fits nicely on tabletops – a great pick for tailgating and outdoor parties
cons: Tends to cook hot, requiring close attention to prevent burning food
Sometimes takes several attempts to start, and the starter sticks out awkwardly from the unit

customer_reviews.title: Bad product!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grill from Amazon. Replaced it once because it stop working correctly( low flame). Amazon arranged for a replacement. Same problem happened again. Called Amazon and surprisingly they refused to replace again. Was told to contact Smoke Hollow. I have attempted to reach them several times to no avail. So now I have a grill($85) which is no good to me,Amazon who is of no help( very surprised ,maybe Amazon is suffering from TOO BIG SYNDROME) .This product is no good and company is worse.
customer_reviews.author: louis rizk

customer_reviews.title: assebling...dropping screw inside lid
customer_reviews.text: caution. when affixing the handle, tape first over the large hole so that the screw doesn't drop down into the double wall lid. We also found that buying a little bit longer screws work better.
customer_reviews.author: jude

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Easily removable insides for cleaning. highly recommend rather than replacing full size grill every 3-4 years. I like that it has a hot end and cooler end, makes grilling different things taking different times easier. I built small table and use as my daily grill. Buy the hose (as I did) to adapt to full size LP tanks and your all set.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Flawed piece of useless sheetmetal cannot be assembled for safe use
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 tiny spot welds holding the burner in place, one of which was already broken on arrival. When trying to assemble, the venturi tube (end of burner tube) did not extend far enough to engage the regulator valve. Useless piece of sheetmetal junk. Discovered flaws too late to return. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tempesst

customer_reviews.title: Lid and temp gauge are useless.
customer_reviews.text: Used ours for the first time this weekend while camping. It has a nice lid with a temperature gauge so you would think you could use it with the lid closed-right. NO-even with the temp set on lowest setting the grill got to 450 degrees with the lid closed. I called the manufacturer this morning and was told you can't cook with the lid closed. Really??? Then what good is the gauge??? We had a much cheaper model before and used a griddle on it most of the time for cooking breakfast--this one says do not cover more than 50% of surface with griddle. I wish we had not purchased this grill.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe2

customer_reviews.title: Quality control should not have missed
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 Star except for POOR quality control. Brace that held the burner in position was not Tacked properly to bottom of grill. Burner was floating. Had to drill through the brace and the bottom of the Grill and secure with nut and bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: NICE CONCEPT WITH LOTS OF FLAWS!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had read all the reviews before I bought this grill. Total waste of money. Bracket holding burner was only welded in one spot out of four, and even then it was welded in wrong place. The jet in the regulator came no where near fitting into the burner venturi. Big safety issue! I had to replace screw and lock washer that fell in between the inner and outer cover, minor detail, but could have been designed better. Ignition wire housing was cracked. I gave up upon seeing that issue and chalked it up to, lesson learned: you get what you pay for. I I’d contact Amazon about sending it back, but it’s just not worth my time.
customer_reviews.author: RJB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent grill!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent grill!! Heats up nicely and cooks food perfectly! We bought this grill for our boat and it's just what we wanted. Would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: LoveCows

customer_reviews.title: awesome portable camping bbq
customer_reviews.text: other than a couple little fitment issues, which are minor. such as the latching mechanism. just tighten up with pliers. I absolutely love this grille. I take it everywhere we go camping. no issues with wind,ignition,hot spots. very well even heat and conservative on fuel.really nice that the legs fold to help pack away. the quality is right up there. a very nice looking grille as well.i see this lasting me MANY years and I'm a heavy bbq kind of guy. before you buy any other camping grille please do yourself a favor and give this one a couple glances. I would definitely recommend this one!
customer_reviews.author: toddzilla

customer_reviews.title: Looks Pretty
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grille last April and the burner had already begun to break down, the only part that burns bright is about 6 to 8 inches at the U end of the burner, the rest of the burner barely lights up, I had a similar style grille before it but its burner lasted about 1.5 years and did the same thing. If you want a grille thats shiny, but you dont cook, give me your address and ill mail it to you. The most important part, the burner, is junk, and no, degreasing and pressure washing it did not help. But hey, it looks pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel W

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control!Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Burners positioned and inch or so higher on one side causing heat diffusir to turn bright irange and burning food above it at liwest setting. No way to adjust,had to constantly suffle food around grill to keep from burning.
customer_reviews.author: Dirtfarmer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little grill. Very easy to finish assembly heats well and cooks A steak perfect. The left side does get hotter than the right but that's to be expected since the burner is horseshoe shaped. Has plenty of room to cook A full meal for 2. Took a little getting used to but I mastered it in no time. Seems to be made of quality material and is holding up to daily use Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Russell Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Schizophrenic regulator...
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, it's been a really good grill. Being all stainless (other than the warming rack), it's been withstanding the elements. The big issue is the garbage regulator. It's nothing short of schizophrenic. I've watched it surge from high to low rhythmically or it stays on high no matter what setting or barely lit even on high setting. I've decoupled the hose from tank and to reset the regulator which sometimes helps other times, no. Then there are days it works completely fine. Looking for another regulator.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: This is a great little gril!
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill that is well built. It’s also easy to clean. I’ve used mine at work, picnics, camping, hunting, and off-road events. It’s small enough to easily transport but has enough room to grill for a few people. The only issue I’ve noticed, and it’s been the same with all my small grills, is that it is hard to keep the temperature low even when the knob is set to low. But you just have to watch it a little more. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a sturdy grill that is built to last.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice but some flaws..
customer_reviews.text: The right side doesnt seem to really cook like the left even when on the high setting. It also came dented on the bottom but oh well not returning it since it's not too noticable but it is a good size dent. When installing the handle the screw got lost in between the sheets of metal and I had to go to the hardware store to get a new screw. Should of sent extras or made this product a little bit better to prevent that. Just be careful with the handle the screws can fall inside the metal and be gone forever. Overall pretty nice grill and gets quite hot. Very big for the price and overall pretty cool.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous buyer

customer_reviews.title: But did a good job nevertheless
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews , found some complaints to some what true , but then beauty is in the eye of the beholder ! That said just finished up 10 day camping trip , grill used at lest once daily , Worked well , took some getting used to . Didn't work the same as old cast aluminum one I had , But did a good job nevertheless ! Much lighter weight , stayed going on brisk windy day , was worth my investment . I Ran it off a 20 Lb propane cyl. and adapter hose . I did not install spark lighter , storage space limitations in trailer , light it with propane lighter .
customer_reviews.author: Piper Fox

customer_reviews.title: broken
customer_reviews.text: I loved this grill as a replacement to our grill on our camper. However, it is now broken. We bought it while on the road camping in 2017. We only use it while in the camper (summer months). I went to use it today, and it is broken and flames are coming out where they should not, thus, not allowing me to safely grill. WHAT A WASTE OF MONEY. Now, I need to scramble to find a new one to use this summer for camping. Any suggestions?
customer_reviews.author: Getting There

customer_reviews.title: Gas control does not go low enough!! If you want something that makes your life simpler... THIS IS NOT IT!
customer_reviews.text: Gas control does not go low enough!!! On low it burns and flares up. Might work ok if left open at all times but as soon as you close it temp shoots up to 800. I have a $100 big 5 version of this exact grill at the lake house and temp control is much better. Temp goes lower so when I close it temp stays at about 4-500. They did not have them at big 5 anymore so i decided to take a chance on this one as it is identical and $25 cheaper. Ill figure out how to make it work but if you want something that makes your life simpler this is not it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Love this, perfect for camping with a family.
customer_reviews.text: We love this grill we use it camping it's the perfect size for travel and it seems well made its like bringing a mini version of our home grill with us on the road! Some of the small grills on the market are very small and we have a large family this is a good size for cooking dinner for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Danita Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Disposable Grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is headed to the dumpster in less than 2 years. The flame shield has rusted through and I can't find a replacement part anywhere. The grill grate on mine must have been chrome plated, certainly not stainless and is just bare steel at this point so food sticks regardless of how much cleaning and brushing is done after every use. It is too bad that there is no longevity to this product and so many corners were cut on quality.
customer_reviews.author: AKFishRod

customer_reviews.title: Seems dumb. 2
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars except for 2 points. 1,The legs fold up and under, adding a bunch of moving parts to make this approximately 2" shorter for . . . storage, I guess? Seems dumb. 2, The assembly of the handle to the lid is terrible. Short screws with double washers, and a hollow section in the lid. It is only two screws, but I lost parts, and was unable to complete the simple job of attaching the handle to the lid because of terrible design and short screws. As a grill, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: American Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Sent back. Had to go to BIG 5 to ...
customer_reviews.text: Sent back. Had to go to BIG 5 to get another one, because Prime was out of them. The heat thermostat was at the botton of the BBQ and had broken off.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Nordyke

customer_reviews.title: Good pontoon grill
customer_reviews.text: Love it, heats up fast, and cooks with very even heat. I use it on my pontoon boat, and have no issues with stability, or the deck getting hot. On that point, I have not had it lit for more than 20 minutes at a time. Longer use may cause an issue, but all I cook is fish, or burgers. Roasting a chicken is on the way this weekend, and I will update if I have any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Peanut

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great little grill for my pontoon boat. Attached Arnall's pontoon brackets to grill and it is a great addition to the pontoon boat. Easy push button lighting. Temp control can be a little tricky. Love the removable drip tray on the bottom of the grill. Easy removal and cleaning. Overall well pleased with this grill. Thinking about purchasing an adapter to use a 20lb tank instead of the 1lb canisters.
customer_reviews.author: TSquared

customer_reviews.title: I love the performance of it
customer_reviews.text: You have to attach the handle yourself,to be successful you need a magnatized screwdriver otherwise the screws have a tendancy to fall off in between the top cover and the heat shield inside. I had to pry the two appart to get the screws out, and couldn't get them exactly back in allignment. I love the performance of it, I just wish the handle had been attached at the factory.The igniter and fill valve also must be installed by the user. these went on easily though. I bought this to replace a full size grill that the guts had rusted out of. This fit right on the grates of it and the cover even closed over it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip B. Hale Jr

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 one comes with no hardware so I send it back. Second one comes dented as the pictures show do I need to say more
customer_reviews.author: thomas neve

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed. A charcoal grill would have taken forever to ...
customer_reviews.text: Would be 5 stars, but ... assembly. The screws are so short, and there are no spares. For the handle, I wasn't careful enough and the screw slipped into the space between, and I was not able to get it out. Had to go out to buy one more screw. Other than that, it cooked 2 ribeye steaks in record time and to just MR. I was amazed. A charcoal grill would have taken forever to get to the right temperature. This was so easy. And, the steaks were delicious. Also, it is very nice looking and sturdy. Not too small, not too big, and the temperature gauge on top comes in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Tell It

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Grill!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is exactly as described and fairly easy to assemble the few parts. One word of caution, though. When assembling the handle be very careful about putting the bolt into the handle. It's easy for the bolt to slip out of your screwdriver (even if your screwdriver is magnetic) and fall backwards between the sides of the grill top because that section is hollow. I learned the hard way and ended up having to go the local hardware store to get another one because I couldn't get it out. Overall, though, the grill is well made and I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ruberto

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stainless grill at good price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality stainless grill with fairly large cooking surface, hard to assemble handle, other reviews helped alot. Heats quickly, works well quality construction. Wire grates are not the best for all cooking. Purchased grill mats to make cooking small items easier. Bought 12 ft. Propane extension hose to connect 20 pd. Tank. Works very well like that. Overall good price for very nice looking functional grill that can be used camping.
customer_reviews.author: doityourselfer

customer_reviews.title: Small size is great. Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my main grill at a condo I have. Small size is great. Easy to assemble. Temperature control is an issue on the low end. After it heats up even on low it will stay at 400 or higher. The internal heating components are cheaply made and very tinny. I give them two years max before rusting out. Manufacturer: I would pay $25 more if you included a good quality burner and heat pan. Sadly at this price it's a disposable after a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Elmo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: We used this to finish off our steak/pork chop that we sous vide in preparation for a 10 day hunting trip to Colorado. I have continued to use it throughout this years hunting season and it is still in great shape ready for next year. I will be packing this in the boat for winter steelhead season also. Packs a way nicely, cook evenly, well built, Great product! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Turtle

customer_reviews.title: no customer service
customer_reviews.text: having an issue with the regulator on assembly. called customer service twice. first time, hold for 20 mins, never answered. second time, hold for 25 mins, never answered. is this even really a company? not at all impressed with the way the regulator is attached and inserted. looks flat out dangerous (or possibly not fitting properly). would love a chance to ask the co about this. apparently, cannot have one. going to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: M. Frank

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little grill for camping or boating
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little unit for use on our boat. Heat pattern is easy to learn and cook with to time different meats or vegetables. Heat convection is very efficient. Pros- compact, easy to clean, fast heat, limited grease flaring, sturdy. Cons- whatever is on the top rack drips over the back of unit when lid is open. Assembly is quick and simple with hand tools. Adjust the ignitor as needed after it's together and be mindful of the weight stress the fuel bottle puts on the valve mount when transporting or storing it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible design for putting the handle on...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't actually used the grill yet but want to mention that trying to put the handle on was absolutely awful! The screw is too short to put it through the tiny little space it has to go to connect to the handle! It must have fallen inside the lid of the grill at least 10 times and it is very hard to get it out!!! It took 2 of us to put it on which is ridiculous. I will write another review after we take it camping. Assembly of this grill sucks!
customer_reviews.author: swalls

customer_reviews.title: Masterbuilt model 205 Counter Top Gas Grill
customer_reviews.text: It is a great little gas grill that can cook four good size steaks at a time. Easy to take along to picnics and tail gating with friends. It was easy to assemble with instructions. A plier and screwdriver is all that you need. I purchased an extension hose so I could attach the unit to a five gallon gas can. It was also a good value.
customer_reviews.author: KMax

customer_reviews.title: Sorry I bought it, and that's before even using it.
customer_reviews.text: First, I had to contact Amazon (who were very helpful) NO manual enclosed, and the link on the product site was a manual that could not be read. They got me one. Now while assembling, it calls for bolts that are NOT included. Not missing, mind you. But are called for in the instructions and also NOT listed on enclosed parts. Genius, no? I only hope it works decently.
customer_reviews.author: M. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Nice grille at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill to use at home for my wife and I. I didn't want a big grill that would sit outside. I store this one in the garage, I use camper propane bottles because we grill occasionally and they don't take a lot of storage space. I like that it is all stainless steel so it won't rust. It has enough cooking surface for our needs that include grilling for our family members that live in the area - it is not suitable for large outdoor parties - but that is not an issue for us.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Cottone

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Pick a different one!!! Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: It came with multiple small dents. The top wire rack continuously falls and pops out if the holes. This would be a safety hazard if I tried to cook with it. It has big scratches in multiple spots on the inside. The front latches are not attached and fall off. It appears it has been used but cleaned really well. The lid was bent to the side and with very little effort it bent back. Poor material. Not happy after a week of wait.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Gentry

customer_reviews.title: " Spark sparked but doesn't light and worse: the latches don't work at all--very loose and ...
customer_reviews.text: Dissapppointed. Cheaply constructed. Metal bent. Doesn't close "squarely." Spark sparked but doesn't light and worse: the latches don't work at all--very loose and useless. If it wasn't for the fact that I need it for camping soon I would return it. I would not recommend to a friend. As a follow-up AFTER my camping trip, the grill worked but one of the main screws holding the lid hinge fell out on the ground. When we packed up I actually asked my wife if she wanted to toss the grill or bring it home. We brought it home, but it was a rediculous choice to consider for an $80 grill.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but not practical for anything but burgers.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill because it has an upper rack. Grilling with single burner requires the upper rack to lower the temperature for some of the smaller, thinner faster cooking foods. Unfortunately, there is only 1 1/2" of space above the upper rack with the lid closed. The legs and drip pan make this unit unnecessary tall. The grill is beautiful stainless steel and very attractive but I would trade it even for a cheap $29 grill fromWalmart, but unfortunately have stopped selling. Too much money spent on engineering and not in making the cooking chamber more usable.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Lathem

customer_reviews.title: Cooks fast
customer_reviews.text: I cut the top off of my old grill, put on a piece of plywood and my new grill fits perfect. I have it hooked up to the big propane tank in the bottom of the old grill. The heat source is closer to the food so it cooks faster and saves time. Watch it closely.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: Great product and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased it for a recent camping trip. It worked beautifully. The heat was easy to control and very even. But what was really impressive was the customer service. Due to shipping, the temperature gauge was broken. I called customer service and the lady who answered was able to help me without going through menus and submenus. I explained the issue and she immediately said no problem, I'll send a new one out today. This is how customer service is supposed to work.
customer_reviews.author: Henrik E. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I have it on top of my Masterbuilt 30 inch electric smoker, and it fits perfectly. It's light, but well made. Everything I've cooked on it so far comes out great with grill marks to boot. I can't wait to just pack it up and take it camping. I love how it closes like a suitcase. I plan on throwing a couple utensils in there for storage when i take it camping. If it had a little burner attachment of some sort I'd have given it 6 stars if I could. I highly recommend this product for anyone with a tight patio like mine, or anyone who enjoys camping.
customer_reviews.author: dominick sciarretta

customer_reviews.title: Temp control issues..
customer_reviews.text: I hoped something better. It burns stiff as it is so powerful and the flame is so near the items cooking. My hope originally was that it will serve as an ok little fire over but as even the LOWEST will burn the food. It’s beautiful but I feel the heat escapes from the back and only almost direct flames do the work. Chicken pieces with bone take forever hence the end up all black.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Rizik

customer_reviews.title: Great stove a must have for any avid camper of hunter !!!
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this stove 2 times but the second time we camped with 2 of our friends families and were able to cook meat for 16 people on it flawlessly. This is the perfect stove for a familly of 5 like ours or if you go on a group camping trip. its basically like a stainless steel suit case. the only issue I can foresee in the future is the gas connection sticks super far off the one side and eventually I can see that getting bumped hard enough to bend or break off.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Csincsak

customer_reviews.title: Fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: This is a total FIRE HAZARD! There is no temperature control. What. So. Ever. I tried to control the temperature by manipulating the propane tank. No dice. Everything is 500+ degrees. I even bought an adapter and a 20 lbs tank. Same problem. Looks pretty. Doesn't even come close to doing it's job, unless you love to burn everything. Cheers, sending this piece back.
customer_reviews.author: fast eddy

customer_reviews.title: Good addition for my hot dog cart
customer_reviews.text: It's been good and I will buy another one. It has a few hot spots I'm not crazy about and adjusted the shield over the burner to help this. Otherwise it's been mounted on my hot dog cart working great all summer and fall. It's been traveling on the road and so far has been a solid addition for me. Other than tweaking the heat shield everything seems to be a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: This will be the only grill you'll ever have to buy..ever, excellent quality!!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made, excellent value, The heat diffuser plate may shift a little and make sure the four little tabs are in place before use. I cooked six large T-bone steaks and used about half of a 2 lb propane bottle, I used steel wool to clean up, but think a scrubber or sponge would do better, get a scrubber with a handle as the metal has sharpish edges. This will be the last BBQ grill I'll ever have to buy, it is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill- just gets super hot really fast
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill, but gets hot super fast. You have to keep an eye on it so it doesn’t scorch your food. Otherwise, for the size it’s a fantastic grill. Bought it initially for a small condo balcony. We moved to a large house and are still using it because it’s effective and we can easily tuck it into the garage and it doesn’t take up much room. We really like it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: It's sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The first one had a broken temperature gauge so I sent it back for an exchange. The next one was fine. I like it just fine, except I have to remove the top rack before I can pull out the bottom rack for cleaning and the top rack falls all crazy once you take out one side. Also I have to unscrew the burner for cleaning. This would have been better with clamps. That frustrated me but everything else is great. The size is convenient and it's sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Black fuel soot on everything, yuck.
customer_reviews.text: When cooking, black soot was on all the food and on the spatula. Only used 1 time to cook 4 burgers and 8 hotdogs. Everything came covered in black soot, you could taste the fuel. Uneven cooking was to the extreme, where two burgers were done, the other two where raw, but blackened by the soot. Grease came out of the back almost as much as it came down to the grease catch. As soon as the grease it the bottom, it would cause awful flare ups. Overall, this has the ne the worst grill I have ever used. Will definitely read all the reviews before purchasing another one.
customer_reviews.author: Erik P.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our boating adventures
customer_reviews.text: We like to take visitors to an island via boat for picnics and this portable grill has been perfect for grilling burgers and steaks for a dozen people. It was such a clever design to have the cover flip clips and the lid handle double as a carry handle. I read other reviews before buying and I find the drip pan is perfectly adequate for each use. Cleans and stores easily. We did buy the adaptor hose to attach to a larger 20# propane tank. We also bought the roll up aluminum tables as a stand to keep it off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Kaysi12

customer_reviews.title: just OK
customer_reviews.text: This little grill is a clear case of you get what you pay for. It works. It's pretty. It's also very cheaply made and I suspect I'll be throwing it overboard at the end of the season. Maybe next. The upper cooking/heating grill is a joke. Don't even bother - just throw it away right away. It won't stay in place and when it falls out it just dumps what ever you put on it on to whatever is on the lower grill. the thermometer seems responsive and consistent. Heats up pretty quick and will cook your steak. But there is a reason that some of these cost $300.00 and this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Uneven heat
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well made, easy to transport grill. Only complaint is that one side heats well enough to sear, while the one closest to the propane does not. As long as one is aware of this, it can even help with timing of different items that need different heat. It's a good portable grill for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa603

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware to assemble. Company won't help.
customer_reviews.text: After 20 minutes on HOLD Smoke Hallow could not help replace missing hardware without proof of purchase emailed to them. This makes the purchase very unenjoyable and I can use the BBQ! I'd stay away from this one. Bad / NO customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A.  Margucci

customer_reviews.title: For the price and size I'm satisfied at this time.
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price in my opinion. Only needed a screw driver to set it up. Used it and set it up at our horse camp right there on the picnic table. Grilled a tri tip roast to perfection. The grill runs hot, even with low fuel. Had to prop door open with a stick a couple of inches to reduce heat (this will also heat up the handle btw). The thermostat seems to work fine, while the starter not so well. Also tried some ribs on it, but they came out too well done but I was less attentive to the temperature by this time. For the price and size I'm satisfied at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Madume

customer_reviews.title: All stainless
customer_reviews.text: I love that this grill is all stainless steel. It is very stable on the small table I have. I had a problem with it getting enough gas to heat up so called company. They talked me through a simple way to get rid of an air lock. Worked fine then. I still have problems with wind, but have wrapped some foil around legs and that seems to help. (We get a lot of wind here). The legs fold up and the lid fastens shut for transporting.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Good looking product with descent design
customer_reviews.text: Good looking product with descent design. However, when you do BBQ with it, it is not working as a BBQ grill. It will turn all the food into smoke covered food. I should attach some pictures with this comment, but I don't even think about taking those disgusting pictures while I feel so much disappoint. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Qiang, Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill is being used at my house !!️ Perfect for 2 people and easy to hook up a hose to a 20 lb propane tank !!️ Great heat and and the stainless steel construction is perfect !!️
customer_reviews.author: Dick Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Low quality product
customer_reviews.text: At first this portable gas grill looked and worked great. But after a few months of occasional use (we use a charcoal grill for 95% of all our BBQ'g) it has started to rust out; auto igniter stopped working; thermometer no longer works and inner heat shield is falling apart. I would have expected a longer lasting product. Not worth spending near $80.
customer_reviews.author: KFSS

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, works really well, becareful with regulator.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this grill, love the spring latches and electric start. We use it on our pontoon boat, makes for a great day on the water. Only dislike for me is the regulator is meant to be permanently attached and seems vulnerable to impact. My solution was to carry regulator separate and attach when needed then remove again for storing. That being said, it's still a great little grill, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Susie Matthews

customer_reviews.title: First impression BAD
customer_reviews.text: Just used it for the first time for some steaks and hot dogs. Very bad flare ups! I had to leave it on low the whole time. Also the left side is so much hotter than the right side. I tried locking it to carry it and the left one broke, very fragile. When assembling, easy instructions but where the flames come out, it was welded too far to the left I had to shift/bend it to the right with my hands. Very bad product. I will try it a couple more times before fully giving up on it...
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: great.......
customer_reviews.text: for a travel grill....... a quick set up..... can use a bottle or buy an adapt kit for a big tank.... works good. .... have cooked several times with it and no issues....... a challenge to assemble but it can be done........ I have not had to clean it yet but expect to be easy... will disassemble and wash and clean then heat up and dry out..... I like it.... especially for the price...
customer_reviews.author: Justin p

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for one to two people. Smoke Hollow listened to customer reviews. I didn’t find any sharp edges, and the wood handle was replaced with metal. I use a 20# LP tank with a hose so I don’t run low on gas which keeps the grill hot. The open, center area is great for searing while the outside edges are great for lower heat cooking. I can sear a strip steak to medium in ~4-1/2 minutes per side with the lid down. It doesn’t get any easier than that.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Moore

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but isn't exactly perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grill to possibly replace my Char-Broil portable. Pros: It gets hot and definitely cooks well Cons: Top rack makes it very difficult to flip burgers in the back...I think I'm going to remove it Because of the burner design, the left center side of the grill gets much hotter than the rest of the grill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: The grill itself is nice, portable and easy to maintain but from day one, the grill does not heat well or evenly. It took us twenty-five minutes to grill some hot dogs and the one on the left still weren't cooked. I changed out the bottle thinking perhaps that was the issue but it mattered little.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Does everything well but cooking
customer_reviews.text: PRO's: Very portable, nice design, hood latches, AWESOME! CON's: Cooking is awful. Heat adjustment makes ZERO difference. This grill has only 1 setting-FULL BLAST-500 degrees. Low or any other temp simply doesn't work. Heat distribution is terriblel. I wasn't expecting "Weber" like results.....but you have to BURN your hamburgers to cook the middle and you'll still notice 1 side of the patty is cooked, other side isn't.
customer_reviews.author: DP JR.

customer_reviews.title: An assembly headache.
customer_reviews.text: This unit was not as nice as I hoped and the assembly was a total pain. One of the screws slipped & disappeared in the cover. There was no way to recover it. I must have spent 2 hours trying to recover it. Once I did, I packed it up and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Stevie G

customer_reviews.title: Super nice little grill
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice grill. Gave it to my husband for the holidays to use when we go out in our new travel trailer. It's beautiful, perfect size, nice weight. Had a little trouble with the assembly - had to deconstruct the top to get a screw out. Other than that, we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Long-time Mom

customer_reviews.title: Smoke Hollow Grill Review
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the quality and fairly quick easy assembly of the grill. Cooks up raw hamburgers inless than 8 minutes! No complaints! Perfect for a small familys grilling needs!
customer_reviews.author: Jason W.

customer_reviews.title: Bad regulator?
customer_reviews.text: Purchased grill for RV as Christmas gift for husband, tried using for first time two weeks ago. No flames. Sent to RV dealer to see if there was anything wrong with propane line, but gas flowed. They determined there was a problem with the regulator. Took to grill/outdoor specialist, wanted $50 to exchange..I only paid $100for the grill! So now I'm stuck with a shiny new grill that doesn't work. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are all good. Nice grates, lid and components. Assembly was all straight forward. Lost pounts for design on two specific areas. The ignitor and the fuel connector both stick out off the side. This is fine during use but gets in the way when it is being packed/stored/moved. I am removing the regulator when not in use to avoid damage. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Prime Shopper

customer_reviews.title: great little camping cooker
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it a 3-star rating for Temp Control b/c I'm not sure how to do it & it might be my fault. The cooker heated up well and seemed to hold the heat just fine. We made hot dogs and they were yummy. I was even able to cook eggs and sausage for breakfast!+
customer_reviews.author: ReiSli

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Very well designed. Easy to carry and easy to use. Works with either the one pound propane cans, or if used with a hose (not inlucded), can be used with large tank. Has a bun warmer and a temp gauge built in. Big enough to cook eight burgers or a whole cut up chicken. Does require some assembly but it's easy and the instructions are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Steelman

customer_reviews.title: Turned into a Forge
customer_reviews.text: Used 3 times and it turned into an episode of Forged in Fire. Regulator malfunctioned and went full open. Swirling roaring flame inside cabinet. Picked up table it was on and threw in lake. It got so hot the metal glowed red.. Grill inside was glowing bright red and started sagging. Was a cool grill the few times i used it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Silver carry
customer_reviews.text: I was barbecueing some steaks and as it drips it all got on fire not designed for steaks and maybe do some hot dogs and stuff like that chicken small wings but trust me don’t even try to do a ribeye steak everything will just burn but the barbecued looks amazing small u can carry it and assembly was easy love the look too but not what I thought used it once and now it’s just sitting in my shed
customer_reviews.author: Amel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Table Top Grill!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome table top grill! Took only a couple minute to assemble. The igniter seems to work perfect right out of the box, I saw a few complaints in other reviews but I found no such problem. The gas tube is U shaped which allows grease drippings to fall without landing on the heat shield & helps to cut back on flare ups. I was able to pick this up while it was on sale before Xmas & I am glad I did. It works great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too freaking hot!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking grill, but control is garbage. Grill burn too hot to adequately be used to cook. I am opting for something better. Loved the look of the grill, wish they developed a better control valve. It seem to only have one setting, wide open or nothing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This grill is terrible. Once I got it out of the box I should have known. It felt cheap. But after I got it up and roaring I quickly realised the temperature control is worthless. It's on or it's off that's about it. Safe your money and buy something else
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it was a good use of money
customer_reviews.text: It is compact and it cooks. The temperature across the cooking area is a bit uneven. This leaves less area to cook in if you don't want to burn your food.. It takes some technique to cook on this grill. You definitely can't load it up. Other than that, it does serve it's purpose... It is compact and you can take it with you. Not sure if it was a good use of money, I'm wishing I would have spent a bit more and got something that has a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Crilly

customer_reviews.title: replacement cost too PROHIBITIVE to buy
customer_reviews.text: after a year and a half the regulator has stopped. Grill will not light and the cheapest I can find online is 20.00 plus ten for shipping. Its a third of the price of a new one and not money I am willing to spend. Ill look for another brand and scrap this stainless steel for $5.oo SCRAP money. Will not buy another smoke hollow
customer_reviews.author: ZIPPER BOOKS

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic grill
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a construction superintendent and he travels. I bought this so he could grill wherever he is. His crew love it when he grills. It is wonderful. Cleans up easily, cooks like a large grill. Perfect for tailgating. We travel with ours. Fast shipper. Product as described.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little outdoor grill that acts as a great standin ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little outdoor grill that acts as a great standin while I work on a more permanent solution. Not the hottest grill, but unless in a direct breeze on a cold day can easily get up to 700 degrees internally. Sufficient for grilling needs as long as they're simple. Warming rack just seems like an extra thing to get in the way, but I don't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Norris Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship. Good design
customer_reviews.text: I like it’s stainless steel. Poor manufacturing quality control. The majority of spot welds do note even hold some aren’t even touching both metal surfaces. I can see will not last long. Nice design. Would not recommend purchase due to poor quality. I had even bought travel bag
customer_reviews.author: Bruce VBerg

customer_reviews.title: Low or high heat. Not good for cooking
customer_reviews.text: Not that happy with this unit. Missed the window to return. The part that connects to the propane offers low and high heat. Low doesn't cook and high burns. The unit itself doesn't have heating options. If there is another cord I can use for propane that offers low med and high, the review would be good
customer_reviews.author: sbpere

customer_reviews.title: this is the grill you want for your BOAT
customer_reviews.text: I attached this grill to my pontoon boat rail. Its a great size I can cook 6 burgers and 10 hot dogs at once. stainless steel construction. very well constructed. the U burner really helps distribute the heat iv had it for about a week now used it twice and its the bomb.
customer_reviews.author: josh drew

customer_reviews.title: Parts are missing
customer_reviews.text: The product LOOKS like it will be lots of fun and very useful. However, I can't put it together because there are no nuts included with the screws to put it together. I will have to go out to a hardware store to find nuts that fit the screws or find screws and nuts that fit and will work in a high heat environment. Not what I expected. The three stars are in anticipation of the thing actually working when I get it together. Hopefully before the cookout party.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price
customer_reviews.text: We use a 5 lbs bottle and hose with this grill and set it up on a camp table. The grill is well made, very sturdy, and easy to clean. Smoking and cooking is easy and predictable because of the quality burner and regulator.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend C. Joseph Fifer

customer_reviews.title: First use and out of the box success.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! Unlike many other reviewers posts, the ignitor worked out of the box for me. Ten minutes for setup and i heated the unit up to burn off any excess machine oils. Only concern is, I couldn't get a decent char on my first batch of burgers even on high heat, but perhaps that will come with a more seasoned grill. The grill sits nicely on the tailgate of my truck, and perhaps the wind was a little much to get the char I was looking for. But so far, this little grill is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: HandsomeHal

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill
customer_reviews.text: The grill is great but it was missing the screws to attach the handle. The latches were not installed properly. We had to square up the latches with the edge of the grill and attach the springs in the latches so that when it was locked you could pick it up with the handle to carry it. This has nothing to do with the operation of the grill but it looks like during manufacturing the person or persons assembling it did not do their job properly.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Careful with handle screws
customer_reviews.text: Advice on assembly - I returned mine before use because I had trouble with what should have been simple assembly. The hood has a double "hull", so space in to lose the handle screws which I did and no easy way to recover them, and the edges are sharp when I tried. So careful hold the screws when you attach the handle.
customer_reviews.author: BamBam

customer_reviews.title: Only a couple uses before having issues.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this product but I OVER PAID for what I got ( CRAP), the outside is great, but the pieces on inside are cheap and it causes things to cook uneven and not a very strong flame. The first use or 2 were great but it kinda clogs if that makes sense.
customer_reviews.author: Josephine

customer_reviews.title: Read my review before clicking please.
customer_reviews.text: I’m bummed here. I read the reviews and thought I shopped wisely. The fact is, either the bottom stainless strip over the grease drip pan bowed when it was tack welded on, or the design is ineffective. Problem: grease does not drain. Grease collects on the bottom of the BBQ. Mind you folks, this BBQ is shallow. These two confluences do not add up to 5 stars, this adds up to grease fire and a difficult to clean BBQ. I’m tempted to either contact the manufacturer or look for a local welding guy. If there were risers under that bottom strip that runs over the grease drip pan, it would fix a lot of this problem.
customer_reviews.author: camaskyle

customer_reviews.title: but the ease of use and the "instant" fire makes it a good tool in my cooking arsenal
customer_reviews.text: My first ever gas grill ... I am a charcoal man from way back, but the ease of use and the "instant" fire makes it a good tool in my cooking arsenal!!! I will still use my charcoal when I have the time for all that is involved, but for a quick cook and ease ... this is excellent!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bednarek

customer_reviews.title: Support is weak
customer_reviews.text: I found assembly easy. However, the igniter wire gave off a very small spark and wouldn't light the burner. A match worked well. I called support and they sent the wrong assembly to correct the problem. I received a large apparatus for a different grill. I only needed the small igniter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: The gas interface is a little tricky, since you need to assemble it, and there is this one tiny nut...any how, very impressed by the product overall. Word of caution: the internal temperature rise very fast, and it is a bit difficult to keep it on the lower end...if you wish to grill/bake at 325 degrees, you will have to keep opening the lid, or leave something that prevents the lid from closing all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great lil BBQ
customer_reviews.text: Great lil BBQ. It is all stainless drip tray is easy to clean and remove. Perfect to take out in the woods or the lake and not lug a big BBQ around. I bought the adapter hose to use full size propane tanks for weekend outing. Out for a day small bottle works great too. For well under 100 bucks well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay H.

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: So far this is a great portable grill. The grill needed a little assembly but the built in ignitor is a bonus! I find it is necessary to find the sweet spot on the temp control to get it to 450 degrees. I cooked a 1 1/2" steak on it and it came out perfect. I really love my grill and I;m perfectly happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Gets HOT
customer_reviews.text: Powerful little grill that makes grilling a steak easy. I grill with the lid closed and 4 minutes a side is perfect for medium rare. Heats up quickly and has a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmyford

customer_reviews.title: Good little grill
customer_reviews.text: Good little grill. Perfect for tailgating, boating and camping. The legs fold up and the lid has clasps to keep it closed. This is built to be inexpensive and lightweight so I don't expect it to last more than a few years of occasional use but I'm OK with that! I'll buy another when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave T.

product_meta.title: Masterbuilt 205 Stainless Steel Gas Grill, Tabletop (Old Version)
product_meta.description: Color:Tabletop (Old Version)This portable stainless steel table top gas grill is built for the BBQ-grillers on the go. The long-lasting stainless steel construction allows you to enjoy outdoor cooking wherever you enjoy it most - on picnics, camping, boating, tailgating or even in your own backyard. The compact design, with locking lid, folding legs and large front carry handle makes this grill very portable and easy to transport or store. The grill operates on small, disposable one-pound propane cylinders (not included), which are available nationwide as a common camping accessoty item. Grill/Smoker Features - Grease Pan,Heat Thermometer,Warming Rack
feature_bullets: 205 sq. in. primary stainless steel cooking area 105 sq. in. chrome-plated warming rack
Fold-able stainless steel legs; Uses 16oz. disposable cylinder
Stainless steel drip tray; Temperature gauge
Assembled Size: 19 L x 32 W x 33.5 H inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars1,793 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
